item.description:
Cape Ann has many wild areas and Gloucester is filled with restaurants and pubs. There are fish & chips to be eaten and ales to be drunken.

Today we hike the infamous Dogtown of Gloucester!

Dogtown Commons was once a respectable community of 100 Cape Ann families beginning in the 17th century. But eventually it descended into a ghost town inhabited by witches, feral animals, and half-feral humans! There are dozens of numbered cellar holes from long-ago residents, and tales of witches' curses and howling dogs roaming the woods.


And it is surrounded by hundreds of acres of forest with miles of trails to explore.

 

There are also engraved boulders with inspirational messages that were carved during the Depression by out-of-work stonecutters! Don't know if that's cool... or creepy...


And... Gloucester promises seafaring history and lots o' ale!

We'll hike for 3-4 hours then head to Cape Ann Brewing for a pint or two. Or maybe we'll try Guiseppe's Italian Ristorante featuring a piano played by the owner.

Carpool: 10:45 AM @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. There are two parking lots. Meet in the back of the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Ave. Meet at the very back of the lot. Call me if you can't find us!

Newburyport Carpool: 11AM. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95. (Post a comment if you want to meet here.)

Ironically, No Dogs on this hike. Rough!

Liability Release

Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Mysterious DOGTOWN and Fisherman's ALE!
